result.execSummary:
The defendant Elena C Koncar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.20-.249)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered Defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) for 24 months.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
*8-4-2022 Honorable Jonathan Richards: Accordingly, the judgment of conviction shall be amended to specify that the defendant is convicted of the greater alcohol concentration enhancer under WIS. STAT.  346.65(2)(g)2.
Huber Privileges for work, treatment, and to attend AA meetings.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay costs and surcharges during period of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered against the defendant.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
ORDER AMENDING JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION signed and filed
Per order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jonathan D. Richards, Br. 30, for review. mag
DOC letter
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Elena C Koncar in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit for 2 days time served, Huber Privileges for work, treatment, and to attend AA meetings.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 60 days condition time, Huber for work, treatment, and to attend AA meetings.  Court will allow electronic monitoring and good time credit.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Court ordered Defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 24 months.  Court ordered Defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) for 24 months.
- Court ordered Defendant to pay a fine of $1,800.00 plus all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and IID) to be paid during probation. CASH BAIL TO APPLY.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised Defendant of his/her right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Elena C Koncar in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.
